about.intro.paragraph1.message: Hey, I'm Walter Gui üëã I translate between human language and technical complexity. My job? Helping teams build products people actually understand and enjoy using.

about.intro.paragraph2.message: You might have noticed‚Äîmy English name sounds like ‚ÄúWater.‚Äù That‚Äôs no accident. It reflects my core philosophy for technical communication:

about.intro.quote.message: Knowledge is like water‚Äîit only has value when it flows.

about.philosophy.paragraph1.message: In the vast ocean of technology, complex code and architecture can be like towering icebergs‚Äîimpressive, yet hard to approach. Great documentation melts those icebergs into clear streams of knowledge, naturally flowing to the people who need it.

about.philosophy.paragraph2.message: In reality, much of our technical knowledge stays ‚Äúfrozen‚Äù‚Äîscattered, jargon-heavy, and hard to apply. Through my work, I aim to set that knowledge in motion, so it can reach its full potential.

about.work.feature1.description.message: I dig into the real problems teams face, not just what features do. Together, we uncover the stories that make technology meaningful to actual humans.

about.work.feature2.description.message: Code is poetry, but most people don't speak fluent Python. I turn technical complexity into stories that make sense, so teams can ship products humans actually understand.

about.work.feature3.description.message: Design practical, relatable examples that make abstract concepts tangible and easier to apply.

about.hero.subtitle.message: I help teams turn complex tech into content people actually want to read. Let's build documentation that flows.

about.work.intro.message: At Flowing Docs, you‚Äôll find a different perspective on technical content creation:

about.work.belief.message: Documentation isn't just words on a page‚Äîit's where products meet people. Every confused user, every 'aha!' moment, every support ticket is feedback that helps us build better bridges.

about.life.hobby1.description.message: Cycling taught me that great rides‚Äîlike great documentation‚Äîneed the right balance of planning and improvisation. Sometimes you take the scenic route, sometimes you sprint to the finish, but you always learn something new about the journey.

about.life.hobby2.description.message: From Raspberry Pi clusters to the latest AI models, I love tinkering with tech that might just change how we work. If it's new and slightly overwhelming, I'm probably experimenting with it.

about.contact.intro.message: Got questions, ideas, or a collaboration in mind? Here‚Äôs how you can reach me:

about.closing.paragraph1.message: Thanks for reading this far! I hope something here sparks an idea or helps you in your work. Whether it‚Äôs about tech or content creation, I‚Äôm always happy to chat.

about.closing.paragraph2.message: Since you‚Äôve made it this far‚Äîwhy not share your thoughts? I‚Äôd love to hear from you.

showcase.description.message: A collection of projects, tools, and documentation engineering practices from my technical communication career. Covering technical writing, DX optimization, and AI integration. Continuously updated‚Äîlet's connect and share ideas.

homepage.feature.focus.description.message: I turn technical complexity into clarity. Through API design, developer experience optimization, and Docs-as-Code workflows, I help teams ship documentation that actually gets used‚Äînot just written.

homepage.feature.ai.description.message: AI isn't replacing technical writers‚Äîit's supercharging them. I experiment with intelligent content generation, automated quality checks, and smart documentation systems that help teams create better content faster.

homepage.feature.ux.description.message: Documentation isn't just about explaining features‚Äîit's about guiding humans through their entire journey. I design content that meets users where they are, whether they're skimming for quick answers or diving deep into complex implementations.

showcase.flowingdocs.description.message: A personal blog built with Docusaurus, focusing on technical writing, developer experience, and content maintainability. Features include dark mode, PWA support, Giscus comments, and SEO optimization.

showcase.tag.personalSite.description.message: Personal websites, blogs, and portfolio projects

showcase.tag.openSource.description.message: Projects with accessible source code and tools

showcase.tag.docusaurus.description.message: Docusaurus customization, component development, and performance optimization

showcase.tag.dx.description.message: Because developers are humans too. Projects that make the developer journey smoother, from first contact to production deployment.
